description: Two storey side/rear extension (to western side of dwelling) and part single, part two storey side/ rear extension (to eastern side of dwelling).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: OS Location Plan (No Ref), 001-28-2013 (Existing Elevations), 002-28-2013 (Existing Floorplans and Roof Plans), & 003-28-2013 (Existing Block Plan) all dated 12/09/2013, Proposed Elevations (004-28-2013), Proposed Floor & Roof Plans (005-28-2013), 006-28-2013 (Proposed Block Plan) all dated 24/12/2013.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Supplementary Planning Document 4,  policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended 2008), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Supplementary Planning Document 4, policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The extension hereby permitted shall only be used for domestic purposes ancillary to the dwellinghouse and not for any self-contained residential or commercial use.  Reason: To ensure that the use of the extension does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Supplementary Planning Document 4, policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of hard and soft landscaping and replacement tree planting shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation/use of the development. The details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the first occupation/use of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies policies 1.1, 1.2 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.10 & 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 5.10, 7.4 & 7.5 of the London Plan (2011).
